text: Mammillaria guillauminiana is a species of plant in the family Cactaceae. ==Distribution== The cactus is endemic to northwestern Mexico, in Durango and Sinaloa states. The species grows in desert scrub habitat, in humus between rocks and in shady places, at in elevation. It was classified on the IUCN Red List as extinct in the wild until rediscovered in 2003. It has been reclassified by IUCN as a Data Deficient species. ==References== guillauminiana Category:Cacti of Mexico Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Durango Category:Flora of Sinaloa Category:Endangered biota of Mexico Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Mammillaria guillauminiana
